intro: Alternanthera tenella var. versicolor, commonly known as the rainbow plant, is a strikingly colorful foliage plant native to South America. It is characterized by its vibrant, variegated leaves that display shades of red, pink, and green, depending on light exposure. The plant thrives in bright, indirect light and requires consistently moist, well-draining soil. It is a popular choice for indoor gardening due to its ornamental value and ease of care. Its foliage changes color throughout the growing season, making it a dynamic addition to any plant collection.
